The first production R1T rolled off the assembly line in Illinois and was delivered to a customer in September 2021. The official [[Environmental Protection Agency|EPA]] range for the Rivian R1T is 314 miles (505 km).{{cite web |url=https://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/Find.do?action=sbs&id=44462 |title=2022 Rivian R1T |website=www.fueleconomy.gov |access-date=17 September 2021 |archive-date=9 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210909005632/https://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/Find.do?action=sbs&id=44462 |url-status=live }} ==History== [[File:Rivian Normal Plant Floor.jpg|thumb|left|First production Rivian R1T rolls off the [[Normal, Illinois]] assembly line, September 2021.]] Rivian unveiled the upcoming truck under the working name A1T in May 2018 but rebadged the vehicle in November 2018 as the R1T.{{cite press release |url=https://media.rivian.com/rivian-releases-debut-video-of-r1t-electric-adventure-vehicletm/ |title=Rivian releases debut video of R1T Electric Adventure Vehicle |work=Rivian |access-date=15 November 2018 |archive-date=5 December 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191205132404/https://media.rivian.com/rivian-releases-debut-video-of-r1t-electric-adventure-vehicletm/ |url-status=live }} Designed to be off-road capable, the 2018 concept design was planned to have {{cvt|14|in}} of ground clearance, feature an 800HP [{{convert|800|hp|kW PS|disp=out}}] electric motor, with the most expensive models being designed to achieve approximately {{convert|450|mi|km}} on a charge.{{cite news| url= https://www.engadget.com/2018/05/21/rivian-ev-truck-suv-detroit/ |title=Inside the automotive startup taking EVs off-road |work=[[Engadget]] |date=21 May 2018 |access-date=28 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180821062642/https://www.engadget.com/2018/05/21/rivian-ev-truck-suv-detroit/ |archive-date=21 August 2018 |url-status=live}} The company claimed that early prototype testing showed the truck to be able to accelerate from {{cvt|0–60|mph}} in under 3.3 seconds, wade through {{cvt|1.1|m}} of water and climb a 45{{space}}[[grade (slope)|degree incline]]. These design objectives were largely achieved in the 2021 production vehicle release. Rivian said{{when|date=September 2021}} it was designing the vehicles to facilitate "car-sharing" with their autonomous features.{{cite web|url=https://www.wglt.org/post/investor-joins-rivian-electric-automaker-staffs |title=Investor Joins Rivian As Electric Automaker Staffs Up |first=Ryan|last=Denham |website=www.wglt.org |date=12 December 2017 |access-date=18 April 2019 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20190418053224/https://www.wglt.org/post/investor-joins-rivian-electric-automaker-staffs |archive-date=18 April 2019 |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |title=2023 Rivian R1T Review, Pricing, and Specs |url=https://evlegacy.com/2023-rivian-r1t/ |website=EvLegacy}} In 2018, Rivian stated it intended to license its electric chassis to other manufacturers as a design base for machinery such as cars and other components.{{cite web| url= https://www.pjstar.com/news/20180522/rivian-in-normal-plans-november-debut-for-electric-off-road-vehicles |title=Rivian in Normal plans November debut for electric off-road vehicles|first=Matt|last=Buedel |website=Journal Star|access-date=18 April 2019|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20190418053216/https://www.pjstar.com/news/20180522/rivian-in-normal-plans-november-debut-for-electric-off-road-vehicles |archive-date=18 April 2019|url-status=live}}{{cite web |url= https://www.autocarindia.com/car-news/pininfarinas-pf1-super-suv-to-use-rivian-tech-410688 |title= Pininfarina's PF1 super-SUV to use Rivian tech |date= 7 December 2018 |publisher= Autocar India |access-date= 16 December 2018 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20181217062643/https://www.autocarindia.com/car-news/pininfarinas-pf1-super-suv-to-use-rivian-tech-410688 |archive-date= 17 December 2018 |url-status= live }} As of 2018, Rivian stated it planned to begin production of the R1T in 2020. In March 2021, Rivian announced plans to develop a network of public charging stations by 2023. Similar to competitor [[Tesla, Inc.|Tesla]], they plan to eventually offer a combination of fast chargers and slower destination chargers, while also selling home chargers.{{cite news |last=Lambert |first=Fred |date=18 March 2021 |title=Rivian reveals impressive map of over 600 planned fast-charging stations and wall charger |url=https://electrek.co/2021/03/18/rivian-reveals-map-planned-fast-charging-stations-wall-charger/ |access-date=2021-03-24 |work=Electrek |archive-date=20 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210320094200/https://electrek.co/2021/03/18/rivian-reveals-map-planned-fast-charging-stations-wall-charger/ |url-status=live }} The target is for 600 Rivian-only Adventure Network sites with 3,500{{space}}[[DC Fast Charge|DC fast chargers]] at high-traffic locations; 200{{space}}kW will be the initial charging speed, with an eventual target of 300{{space}}kW.{{Cite web|last=Lambert|first=Fred|date=2021-03-18|title=Rivian reveals impressive map of over 600 planned fast-charging stations and wall charger|url=https://electrek.co/2021/03/18/rivian-reveals-map-planned-fast-charging-stations-wall-charger/|access-date=2021-08-08|website=Electrek|language=en-US|archive-date=2021-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210911074837/https://electrek.co/2021/03/18/rivian-reveals-map-planned-fast-charging-stations-wall-charger/|url-status=live}} {{asof|2021|03}}, the company is planning 10,000 destination chargers (Level 2, 11.5{{space}}kW) — called Rivian Waypoints — at retail, lodging, and dining businesses, as well as parks and other locations; Waypoint chargers are slated to be available{{when|date=September 2021}} to all EVs with a [[SAE J1772|J1772]] connector.{{Cite web|title=Charging your Rivian – Rivian Stories|url=https://stories.rivian.com/charging-your-rivian|access-date=2021-03-24|website=Exposure|language=en|archive-date=2021-03-19|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210319232140/https://stories.rivian.com/charging-your-rivian|url-status=live}} the first customer vehicle rolled off the production line and was delivered to a customer.{{cite news |url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/business/ct-biz-rivian-production-launch-ev-truck-manufacturer-20210915-mu4eanomhfgkdcnrklimc7kw2q-story.html |title=EV truck startup Rivian launches production in |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211001134843/https://www.chicagotribune.com/business/ct-biz-rivian-production-launch-ev-truck-manufacturer-20210915-mu4eanomhfgkdcnrklimc7kw2q-story.html |url-status=live }}{{cite news|url=https://insideevs.com/news/533085/first-rivian-r1t-assembly-line/ |title=First Production Rivian R1T Rolls Off Assembly Line |work=Inside EVs |last=Kane|first=Mark |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210915214544/https://insideevs.com/news/533085/first-rivian-r1t-assembly-line/ |url-status=live }} The Rivian R1T was initially offered with three different batteries sized 105 kWh, 135 kWh, and 180 kWh of energy storage.{{cite news |last=Lin |first=Kelly |date=2021-09-10 |title=2022 Rivian R1Tk |url=https://www.motortrend.com/cars/rivian/r1t/ |access-date=2021-09-13 |work=[[Motor Trend]] |archive-date=2021-09-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210913204921/https://www.motortrend.com/cars/rivian/r1t/ |url-status=live }} Rivian R1T will have a range of 230 miles with the smallest battery, 314 miles for the medium battery, and over 400 miles for the largest battery. Additional batteries can be mounted in the R1T's bed for improved range. Those backup/auxiliary batteries can be charged by another R1T, if no charging infrastructure is available.{{cite news |title=Rivians will be able to charge each other, auxiliary battery packs confirmed |url=https://www.motorauthority.com/news/1123515_rivians-will-be-able-to-charge-each-other-auxiliary-battery-packs-confirmed |date=17 September 2021 |access-date=2021-09-17 |work=Motor Authority |archive-date=2021-09-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210917021451/https://www.motorauthority.com/news/1123515_rivians-will-be-able-to-charge-each-other-auxiliary-battery-packs-confirmed |url-status=live }} According to [[Car and Driver]] magazine the real world range with a 129 kWh battery ranges from 220 to 280 miles highway driving, depending on tire choice.{{Cite web |date=2022-03-03 |title=2022 Rivian R1T Review, Pricing, and Specs |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/rivian/r1t |access-date=2022-06-16 |website=Car and Driver |language=en-us}} Rivian began delivering the first R1T trucks to customers in October 2021.{{Cite news|last=Foldy|first=Ben|date=2021-11-01|title=EV Startups Lucid and Rivian Deliver First Models to Customers|language=en-US|work=Wall Street Journal|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/ev-startups-lucid-and-rivian-deliver-first-models-to-customers-11635759002|access-date=2021-11-01|issn=0099-9660}} ==Design and specifications== [[File:2022 Rivian R1T in Launch Green, rear left, 05-20-2022.jpg|thumb|left|Rivian R1T Launch Edition, rear view]] The Rivian R1T is an [[electric truck|all-electric]], [[battery electric vehicle|battery-powered]], [[Individual wheel drive]] [[light duty truck|light duty]] [[pickup truck]]{{cite news |last=Sorokanich |first=Bob |title=The Rivian R1T Proves That the Perfect Off-Roader Is Electric |work=[[Road & Track]] |date=28 September 2021 |url=https://www.roadandtrack.com/reviews/a37764868/the-rivian-r1t-proves-that-the-perfect-off-roader-is-electric/ |access-date=29 September 2021 |archive-date=28 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210928213735/https://www.roadandtrack.com/reviews/a37764868/the-rivian-r1t-proves-that-the-perfect-off-roader-is-electric/ |url-status=live }}{{cite news |last=Priddle |first=Alisa |title=2022 Rivian R1T Second Drive: A More Production-Ready Example Only Hardens Our Opinions |work=[[Motor Trend]] |date=28 September 2021 |url=https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/2022-rivian-r1t-electric-pickup-truck-second-drive-review/ |access-date=29 September 2021 |archive-date=28 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210928181656/https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/2022-rivian-r1t-electric-pickup-truck-second-drive-review/ |url-status=live }} The vehicle features four electric motors, one on each wheel, that combine to produce {{cvt|835|hp}} and deliver {{cvt|908|ftlb|Nm}} of torque. * Motors: four [[Alternating current|AC]] [[Permanent magnet motor|permanent magnet]]{{cite news |last=Moloughney |first=Tom |title=2022 Rivian R1T First Drive Review: Electric Off-Road Dominance |work=InsideEVs |date=28 September 2021 |url=https://insideevs.com/reviews/536129/2022-rivian-r1t-first-drive-review/ |access-date=5 October 2021 |archive-date=5 October 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211005032745/https://insideevs.com/reviews/536129/2022-rivian-r1t-first-drive-review/ |url-status=live }} The front two motors produce {{cvt|415|hp}} and {{cvt|413|ftlb|Nm}} of torque while the rear two motors produce {{cvt|420|hp}} and {{cvt|495|ftlb|Nm}} of torque.{{Cite web|last=Gold|first=Aaron|date=2021-08-31|title=The 2022 Rivian R1T Is the Most Remarkable Pickup We've Ever Driven|url=https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/2022-rivian-r1t-electric-pickup-truck-first-drive-review/|access-date=2021-09-13|website=MotorTrend|language=en-US|archive-date=2021-09-15|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210915222549/https://www.motortrend.com/reviews/2022-rivian-r1t-electric-pickup-truck-first-drive-review/|url-status=live}} *Drivetrain: **[[direct-drive]] [[transaxle]]s from the centrally-mounted four motors **[[torque vectoring]] wheel control, senses slip on each wheel with millisecond granularity, "distributes the proper amount of power to each wheel, precisely as needed." *Suspension: "sophisticated suspension architecture" with [[dynamic roll control]]: **ride-height adjustable [[air suspension]]: {{cvt|6.5|in|mm}} of wheel travel allows for ride height of {{cvt|7.9–14.4|in|mm}} **front: adaptive dampers, unequal-length [[Double wishbone suspension|double-wishbone suspension]] **rear: adaptive dampers, [[multi-link suspension]] * Length: {{cvt|217.1|in|m}} Width: {{cvt|81.8|in|m}} (with mirrors folded) Height: {{cvt|72.1–78.3|in|m}}{{cite news |title=To the mountain and back: Rivian's electric truck and its 314-mile range |last=Gitlin |first=Jonathan |work=[[Ars Technica]] |date=28 September 2021 |url=https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/09/rivians-67-500-314-mile-electric-adventure-truck-put-to-the-test/ |access-date=30 September 2021 |archive-date=29 September 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210929130825/https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/09/rivians-67-500-314-mile-electric-adventure-truck-put-to-the-test/ |url-status=live }} * [[Gross Vehicle Weight|Gross vehicle weight]]: {{cvt|8532|lb|kg}} at maximum payload of {{cvt|1700|lb|kg}} * Acceleration: {{cvt|0–60|mph}} time of 3.0 seconds.{{Cite web |date=2022-03-18 |title=Here Are All The Electric Pickup Trucks Arriving In 2022 And Beyond |url=https://www.rategenius.com/electric-pickup-trucks-2022 |access-date=2022-06-16 |website=RateGenius |language=en-US}} Top speed {{cvt|110|mph|km/h}} * Regenerative braking: up to 0.21 [[g-force|g]]. Charges the battery with energy dissipated during braking. * Balance: 51/49 front-rear weight distribution * Range: {{cvt|314|mi|km}} with the standard 135 kWh "Large pack" battery pack. {{cvt|400|mi|km}} with the optional 180 kWh "Max pack" (available 2023) * Battery pack: 7,776 cells ([[2170 battery|2170 type]]) in a nine-module assembly for the 135 kWh battery pack. The [[Li-ion]] cells are manufactured by [[Samsung]]; battery pack is assembled by Rivian in Normal, Illinois. A flashlight is available on the driver-side door containing a Li-ion cell identical to the cells used in the main battery, bringing the total cell count in the vehicle to 7,777.{{cite news |last=Gilboy |first=James |title=2022 Rivian R1T First Drive Review: The Electric Pickup Revolution Is Real, and It's Here 2022}} The chassis includes braking, suspension, and cooling systems with a battery in the center.{{cite web|url=https://www.wglt.org/post/rivian-reveals-Skateboard-chassis-michigan-conference|title=Rivian Reveals 'Skateboard' Chassis At Michigan Conference|first=Ryan|last=Denham|website= |work=[[Bloomberg News]] |date=23 December 2019 |access-date=24 December 2019 |archive-date=24 December 2019 Previously referred to as "Tank Turn" mode, the software to support the feature was not ready and so is not included in the initial production trucks in late 2021. === Storage and towing === [[File:Debut of the Rivian R1T pickup at the 2018 Los Angeles Auto Show, November 27, 2018.jpg|thumb|right|The Gear Tunnel (shown with right door open) provides additional storage space]] The cargo bed is {{cvt|4.5|ft}} long. Its width at the narrowest point, between the wheel wells, is {{cvt|50|in|m}}.{{cite news |url=https://www.autoblog.com/2021/05/11/rivian-r1t-storage-solutions |title=Rivian details R1T storage options and dives into the truck's specs |last=Palmer|first=Zac |date=11 May 2021 |access-date=2021-09-24 |archive-date=2021-06-18 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210618192008/https://www.autoblog.com/2021/05/11/rivian-r1t-storage-solutions/ |url-status=live }} Towing capacity is {{convert|11000|lb|kg|0|abbr=on}}, as tested in conditions exceeding {{cvt|100|F}} on a desert road that is specified by the [[Society of Automotive Engineers]] (SAE) as the standard for determining a vehicle’s tow rating.{{cite news |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2020/09/rivian-r1t-can-tow-up-to-11000-lbs-but-it-will-cut-the-range-in-half/ |title=Rivian R1T Can Tow Up To 11,000 Lbs, But It Will Cut The Range In Half |last=Cauthier |first=Michael |date=18 September 2020 |work=CarScoops |access-date=28 September 2021 |archive-date=12 December 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201212221631/https://www.carscoops.com/2020/09/rivian-r1t-can-tow-up-to-11000-lbs-but-it-will-cut-the-range-in-half/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |date=2022-03-03 |title=2022 Rivian R1T Review, Pricing, and Specs |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/rivian/r1t/specs |access-date=2022-06-16 |website=Car and Driver |language=en-us}} The Class V [[receiver hitch|tow hitch]] is hidden behind a removable panel. The "frunk" — located where the engine would be in a internal-combustion-engine-powered truck — offers {{cvt|11|cuft}} of additional cargo space, and contains 12 V DC outlets, a 15A/120V AC outlet, and a drain. Another storage compartment is the {{cvt|11.6|cuft}} {{cvt|65|in|m}}-long Gear Tunnel, which runs the width of the truck and can be used for storing sports equipment or a number of available accessories. It also has a 12 V DC outlet and a 15A/120V AC outlet. === Off-road driving and overlanding === The vehicle has an air suspension which allows for 6.5 in (17 cm) of vertical travel — the ground clearance can be as low as 7.9 in (20 cm) or as high as 14.4 in (37 cm). Depending on the wheel configuration, the maximum ground clearance can be even higher, at 14.9 in (38 cm). Maximum wading depth in water is 43.1 inches (1094.74 mm).{{Cite web|date=2021-12-23|title=Rivian|url=https://rivian.com/support/article/what-is-the-water-fording-height|access-date=2021-12-23|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211223022126/https://rivian.com/support/article/what-is-the-water-fording-height|archive-date=23 December 2021}} Approach, departure, breakover angles are 35.5, 30 and 26.4 degrees respectively.{{Cite web|date=2021-12-23|title=R1T - Rivian|url=https://rivian.com/r1t|access-date=2021-12-23|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211223023925/https://rivian.com/r1t|archive-date=23 December 2021}} Custom made Pirelli 275/65 R20 [[Off-road tire#All-terrain|all-terrain]] tires are available as an option.{{Cite web|date=2021-09-28|title=Rivian Wheel and Tire Options Revealed - Rivian Stories|url=https://rivianstories.com/rivian-wheel-and-tire-options-revealed/|access-date=2021-12-23|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210928204614/https://rivianstories.com/rivian-wheel-and-tire-options-revealed/|archive-date=28 September 2021}} Custom drive modes—which adjust the suspension, ride-height, throttle and steering—include "All-Purpose, Sport, Conserve, Tow and Off-Road", plus sub modes for off-road that include "Rock Crawl, Soft Sand and Rally."{{Cite web |date=2022-06-03 |title=Rivian Really Wants Owners To Drive In The Sand |url=https://carbuzz.com/news/rivian-really-wants-owners-to-drive-in-the-sand |access-date=2022-06-30 |website=CarBuzz |language=en-us}} Rivian is offering vehicle options for off roading: a reinforced underbody shield with tow hooks, a "camp kitchen"—two induction cooking elements (1440W each, Dometic CI20), a sink, plus 30 pieces of outdoor cooking/dining equipment—that collapses into the R1T gear tunnel,{{cite news |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36920073/rivian-r1t-electric-pickup-camp-kitchen-specs/ |title=Rivian Cooks Up a Built-In Camp Kitchen for Its R1T Electric Pickup |last=Blanco |first=Sebastian |date=6 July 2021 |work=Car and Driver |access-date=18 August 2021 |archive-date=16 July 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210716180154/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36920073/rivian-r1t-electric-pickup-camp-kitchen-specs/ |url-status=live }} as well as a roof-top tent for three. A winch is available as an option and can be controlled via Rivian's [[iOS]] app.{{Cite web |last=Amariei |first=Florin |date=2022-04-07 |title=Latest Rivian App Update Confirms the Winch, It's an Optional Extra |url=https://www.autoevolution.com/news/latest-rivian-app-update-confirms-the-winch-it-s-an-optional-extra-185910.html |access-date=2022-06-30 |website=autoevolution |language=en}} === Hands-free driving === R1T has safety and driver assistance package called the Driver+. On selected highways the truck is capable of self-steering and controlling speed following the instructions of the driver similar to [[Tesla Autopilot|Tesla's AutoPilot]]. During hands-free driving the driver has to keep their eyes on road and Rivian R1T has cameras inside the cabin to monitor the driver's activity.{{Cite web |title=R1T - Rivian |url=https://rivian.com/r1t |access-date=2022-06-16 |website=rivian.com |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=Gastelu |first=Gary |date=2021-10-06 |title=Elon Musk laughs at Rivian's 'autonomous' driving feature |url=https://www.foxbusiness.com/lifestyle/elon-musk-laughs-rivians-autonomous-driving-feature |access-date=2022-06-16 |website=FOXBusiness |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |title=Rivian is making its hands-free driver assistance system standard in ‘every vehicle’ it builds |url=https://social.techcrunch.com/2020/11/11/rivian-is-making-its-hands-free-driver-assistance-system-standard-in-every-vehicle-it-builds/ |access-date=2022-06-16 |website=TechCrunch |language=en-US}} The hands-free feature works well in straight roads but needs driver's input when taking corners.{{Cite web |date=2021-12-15 |title=Rivian Driver+ Vs Ford BlueCruise Vs Tesla AutoPilot - Car, Truck And Vehicle How To Guides - Vehicle Freak |url=https://vehiclefreak.com/rivian-driver-vs-ford-bluecruise-vs-tesla-autopilot/ |access-date=2022-06-16 |language=en-US}} ==Awards== The Rivian R1T was awarded the 2022 [[Motor Trend Car of the Year#Truck of the Year Winners|Truck of the Year]] by ''Motor Trend''.{{cite magazine |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/rivian-r1t-2022-truck-of-the-year/ |title=The Rivian R1T Is the 2022 MotorTrend Truck of the Year |first=Scott|last=Evans |magazine=[[Motor Trend]] |date=13 December 2021 |access-date=13 December 2021}} ==See also== * [[Rivian R1S]], an upcoming electric SUV sharing most of its components with the R1T * [[Ford F-150 Lightning (electric pickup)|Ford F-150 Lightning electric pickup]] * [[Tesla Cybertruck]] * [[Chevrolet Silverado EV]] * [[GMC Hummer EV]] ==Notes== {{reflist|group=note}} ==References== {{Reflist|33em}} ==External links== {{commons category|Rivian R1T}} * {{official website}} [[Category:Electric trucks]] [[Category:Pickup trucks]] [[Category:Production electric cars]] [[Category:Rivian vehicles]] [[Category:Rivian trucks and vans]] [[Category:First car made by manufacturer]]
